meanings.definition: A person who believes in or supports the division of things into two mutually exclusive categories.
meanings.sent1: As a dichotomist, Sarah always saw things as either black or white.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomist in the group argued that there are only two possible outcomes.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomist at the party insisted on dividing the snacks into sweet or salty.
meanings.sent4: Being a dichotomist, Mark saw the world as a series of yes or no questions.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomist's perspective made decision-making seem straightforward and clear-cut.

meanings.definition: One who views the world in terms of binary oppositions.
meanings.sent1: Growing up, she was known as a dichotomist for always seeing things as right or wrong.
meanings.sent2: The dichotomist's analysis of the situation was based on opposing viewpoints.
meanings.sent3: The dichotomist's approach to fashion was to wear either all black or all white.
meanings.sent4: In literature, the dichotomist often interprets characters as either good or evil.
meanings.sent5: The dichotomist's perspective made complex issues seem simpler by breaking them into two clear sides.
